did.unittitle: Speeches of President Elvis J. Stahr
did.abstract: Consists of speeches given by Elvis J. Stahr during his term as President of Indiana University.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Elvis Jacob Stahr, Jr. was born in Hickman, Kentucky on March 9, 1916. He married Dorothy Howland Berkfield on June 28, 1946. They had three children. He was educated at The University of Kentucky, Oxford University, Yale, and Harvard. After graduating from The University of Kentucky, he went on to study law at Oxford as a Rhodes Scholar. He interrupted his law practice in New York to serve as an infantry officer throughout World War II. Dr. Stahr was dean of the University of Kentucky, College of Law in 1948. The University of Pittsburgh named him Vice-Chancellor in 1957. In January of 1959, he was appointed president of West Virginia University, serving until January of 1961 when he was selected by the late President John F. Kennedy as Secretary of the Army, resigning to become Indiana University president July 1, 1962. While president of Indiana University, he was also president of the Indiana Conference on Higher Education and the Midwestern Universities Research Association. He served as chairmen of the American Council on Education Special Committee on Equality of Educational Opportunity. His presidency ended on September 1, 1968. President Stahr died at home from cancer on November 11, 1998.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into two series: Chronological speech files and General files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of remarks, welcomes and speeches given by Elvis Jacob Stahr, Jr. during his presidency of Indiana University from July 1962-September 1968. It also includes notes, correspondence, and research material related to Stahr's speeches, including notes and drafts prepared by Dorothy Collins, who served as Research Associate for the President's Office during Stahr's tenure. The collection is arranged into two series: Chronological speech files and General files.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyrights for records originating with Indiana University administrative units, departments, and other offices are held by the Trustees of Indiana University. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Speeches of President Elvis J. Stahr, Collection C48, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Updated in 2012 in preparation for digitization.
Updated with additional files and description by Mary Mellon, July 2017.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged chronologically by the date each speech was presented.

scopecontent.head: Scope and content note
scopecontent.p: This speech files in this series include final typescripts of speeches, but often also contain drafts, notes, event programs, and other related material.

relatedmaterial.head: Related material
relatedmaterial.p: These folders include cross reference sheets to files in the Indiana University President's Office records, 1962-1968, Collection C304.

scopecontent.head: Scope and content note
scopecontent.p: These documents consist of speech notes for which there are no formal typescripts, as well as unused speeches and remarks.
